result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda R. Bildeau was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.
  • Ordinance Violation - Bail Jumping. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Forest County Clerk of Circuit Court

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amanda R. Bildeau

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Amanda R Bildeau not in court. Called 3:14 PM. FTR recorded. Called  16FO190, 16FO120, 16CM73 and 16CM161. Court questions clerk on current payment plan. Clerk responds payment plan in place currently but defendant is 2 months behind on that one. Court will combine all cases into one payment plan, imposes monthly payment plan of $200/month commencing 2/13/17.
Payment hearing on January 17, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
from defendant asking to combine all fines due and to lower monthly payment amount.

Defendant Amanda R. Bildeau in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:34 AM. Called 16CM108 and 16CM61. Joy needs time to go thru plea forms. Recess at 9:35 to do that. Recalled at 9:45 AM with same appearances. State - resolved - 16CM108 - defendant would plead g/nc to counts #1 and #2 as alleged, counts #3 and #4 are to be DRI, withhold sentence and place on probation for 24 months with conditions of: court costs on each count, AODA and follow thru, maintain absolute sobriety, no possession and no entry into any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 35 hours of community service, comply with any and all family court or tribal court order as related to her children, attend and successfully complete a parenting program, 16CM161 - amend count #1 to City of Crandon ordinance of DC with a $300.00 fine plus costs, #2 - amend to county ordinance of BJ with $300.00 fine plus costs. Bildeau and Joy agree. Court - 16CM108 - dismisses and reads in counts #3 and #4. Bildeau pleads NC to counts #1 and #2 as alleged. Court - 16CM161 - amends count #1 to City of Crandon ordinance of DC, pleads NC, finds G, fine of $300.00 fine plus costs totalling $582.50 - 60 DTP/CO; amends count #2 to county ordinance of bail jumping, pleads NC, finds G, fine of $300.00 plus costs totalling $582.50 - 60 DTP/CO. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea and adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Joy makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Bildeau withholds statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 16CM108, counts #1 and #2 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years, concurrent to each other, with conditions of: court costs on each count - paid thru probation, AODA and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 35 hours of community service, comply with any and all family court or tribal court order as related to her children, attend and successfully complete a parenting program, submit DNA sample with expunction rights given, right to appeal, adjourned.
Warrant which was authorized on 10/19/16 did not go to jail as defendant appeared later and the court quashed the warrant.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 3, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Amanda R. Bildeau not in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:35 AM. State - sent S&C to last known address and not returned, asks for bench warrant, body or $500.00. Court grants. Called at 11:45 AM. Called 16CM108 and recalled 16CM161. Joy informs the Court that she was not aware of her case that was scheduled this morning (16CM161). Court will quash the warrant on 16CM161. Joy waives reading of that complaint and enters NG pleas to all counts on that matter. Joy - 16CM108 - not quite resolved yet. State - pleas to all 4 counts and place on probation for 2 years on all counts. Bildeau is not willing to accept that deal at this point. Joy has gone over the offer with the defendant. Court - bond on 16CM161 - $500.00 signature bond.
